intro: Jaltomata confinis, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or purple in color. Its fruit is a smooth, fleshy berry that ripens to a red or orange hue. Jaltomata confinis is often found in rocky or dry habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
